title: Donnington Way - Cotswolds Pub Walk Route

nearby.description: Cotswold Way Circular Walk - Chipping Campden
Circular Walk from Bourton through Naunton and The Slaughters

images.title: David Stowell / The Queen's Head, Stow market place
images.caption: The Queen's Head, Stow market place. A delightfully unspoilt pub owned by the small Cotswold Donnington Brewery. All told the brewery has 15 pubs and there is a 62 mile Cotswold walk, known as the Donnington Way, which visits each of them. Notice also the royal connection in the pub name. Pretty well all the old pub names in Stow on the Wold have royal connections of one form or another, dating back to the time of the English Civil War when the town was staunchly Royalist.

images.title: Philip Halling / Former Woodland between Longborough and Donnington
images.caption: Former Woodland between Longborough and Donnington. My OS map which is dated 2002 shows this large field as woodland, today, the wood, with the exception of a few mature trees has gone and the land is arable. The electronic OS version is correct. This view is from the Donnington Way.

images.title: The Black Horse Inn, Naunton by Bill Boaden, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The Black Horse Inn, Naunton

images.title: Natalia A McKenzie / The Black Bear Inn, High Street
images.caption: The Black Bear Inn, High Street, Moreton in Marsh. Some parts of the inn go back two or three hundred years supposedly but this is a far smaller establishment than the older coaching inns on High Street.

images.title: Steve Bennett (stevage), CC BY-SA 3.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The Farmers Arms pub in Guiting Power, Cotswolds.

images.title: Chipping Campden-The Square by Ian Rob, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Chipping Campden-The Square

images.title: Roger Davies / The Snowshill Arms
images.caption: Snowshill Arms. The whole village seems to be a cohesive whole, in this tourist village, with the pub here lying opposite the church.

images.title: David P Howard / High Street, Blockley
images.caption: High Street, Blockley-geograph-2097537-by-David-P-Howard

description: Visit the 15 pubs of the Donnington Brewery on this super pub walk through the Cotswolds. The walk starts in Stow on the Wold and heads to a series of delightful Cotswold villages including the famous picture postcard settlement of Bourton on the Water . You then pass through Naunton , Guiting Power and Snowshill where you can stop to visit the National Trust's Snowshill Manor . The next stop if the noteworthy village of Broadway where you can climb to the excellent viewpoint at Broadway Tower Country Park . The route then heads to Chipping Campden , Blockley and Moreton-in-Marsh where you can try the Moreton-in-Marsh Circular Walk . Scroll down the page to view some of the fine old stone pubs you can stop off at on the walk.
